intro: Hyphaene benguelensis var. plagiocarpa, commonly known as the Benguela fan palm, is a species native to the coastal regions of Angola and Namibia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of large, fan-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into clustered, spiny fruits. Its root system is robust, allowing it to thrive in sandy, coastal soils. This variety is adapted to arid and saline environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
